clinical_study.brief_title: Meta-Iodobenzylguanidine (123I-mIBG) Scintigraphy Imaging in Patients With Heart Failure and Control Subjects Without Cardiovascular Disease
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Phase 3 Study Evaluating the Prognostic Usefulness of I-123 mIBG Scintigraphy for Identifying Subjects With Heart Failure Who Will Experience an Adverse Cardiac Event

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to study the utility of 123I-mIBG as a diagnostic imaging agent to predict cardiac outcome in subjects with heart failure and in comparison to subjects without cardiovascular disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a phase 3, open-label, multicenter trial to investigate the prognostic usefulness of 123I-mIBG imaging to identify those subjects with New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class II and III HF who will experience an adverse cardiac event. The study will consist of a maximum of 587 subjects (525 HF subjects and 62 control subjects) administered 123I-mIBG at approximately 40 centres in the United States. Subject status will be monitored at 6-week intervals post-administration of 123I-mIBG to assess the occurrence of adverse cardiac events. The median follow-up is expected to be 9 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of myocardial sympathetic innervation (as either normal or abnormal) for identifying risk of adverse cardiac event.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months or confirmation of 56 adverse cardiac events

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of myocardial sympathetic innervation (numerical H/M ratio) for identifying risk of adverse cardiac event.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months or confirmation of 56 adverse cardiac events

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantitative myocardial 123I-mIBG uptake to identify HF subjects at higher risk of earlier HF progression, potentially fatal ventricular arrhythmias, or cardiac death.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months or confirmation of 56 adverse cardiac events

secondary_outcome.measure: Modeling to predict risk for adverse cardiac events.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months or confirmation of 56 adverse cardiac events

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Study subjects must be adults with an established diagnosis of heart failure (New York Heart Association Class II or III) and reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) (< 35%) or be healthy volunteers without heart disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers are not eligible if they have a history diabetes mellitus, signs/symptoms of neurological disease (eg, Parkinson's Disease, multiple system atrophy, Parkinsonian syndromes), or other diseases known to affect the sympathetic nervous system.
- Subjects with New York Heart Association Class I or IV heart failure are not eligible.
